prompt:
Generate a seamless equirectangular projection planetary map texture.
STYLE: NASA satellite photography, photorealistic, top-down orthographic view as seen from orbit.
FORMAT: Must be a valid equirectangular (cylindrical) projection that wraps seamlessly around a sphere — poles at top/bottom, equator centered.
ABSOLUTELY FORBIDDEN: No text, labels, annotations, legends, icons, UI elements, borders, or any overlay graphics. No fantasy elements like floating islands, crystals, spires, glowing objects, or impossible geology. This must look like a real photograph of a planet taken from space.
RENDER ONLY: Realistic terrain — oceans, continents, deserts, forests, ice caps, mountain ranges, rivers, coastlines — as they would appear in actual satellite imagery.

Theme/setting: A summer planet, with lots of beaches, mountain ranges with natural tones, tropical, deep oceans. No continents, just archipelagos. 
(Interpret thematically — the map must still look like realistic satellite photography)
[PLANET PARAMETERS]:
Planet parameters to match visually:
- Ocean/water coverage: ~50% of surface
- Mean temperature: 25°C (affects ice cap size, desert extent, vegetation coverage)
- Precipitation: 1.1x Earth baseline
- Tectonic activity: 1.3 (higher = more mountain ranges, rifts, volcanic islands)
- Volcanic density: 50% (visible as dark volcanic fields, island chains)
Landmass layout guide (geographic distribution only — render as realistic terrain, NOT as literal fantasy descriptions):
- Continent 1: roughly 45% of total land area
Distribute the 1 landmasses across the map with realistic continental shapes, coastlines, and terrain variety.

Generate a seamless equirectangular projection planetary map texture.
STYLE: NASA satellite photography, photorealistic, top-down orthographic view as seen from orbit.
FORMAT: Must be a valid equirectangular (cylindrical) projection that wraps seamlessly around a sphere — poles at top/bottom, equator centered.
ABSOLUTELY FORBIDDEN: No text, labels, annotations, legends, icons, UI elements, borders, or any overlay graphics. No fantasy elements like floating islands, crystals, spires, glowing objects, or impossible geology. This must look like a real photograph of a planet taken from space.
RENDER ONLY: Realistic terrain — oceans, continents, deserts, forests, ice caps, mountain ranges, rivers, coastlines — as they would appear in actual satellite imagery.

Theme/setting: Une planete jouvencialle, pleine de vie avec des oceans magnifiques et des grands territoires
(Interpret thematically — the map must still look like realistic satellite photography)
[PLANET PARAMETERS]:
Planet parameters to match visually:
- Ocean/water coverage: ~45% of surface
- Mean temperature: 15°C (affects ice cap size, desert extent, vegetation coverage)
- Precipitation: 1x Earth baseline
- Tectonic activity: 1.3 (higher = more mountain ranges, rifts, volcanic islands)
- Volcanic density: 25% (visible as dark volcanic fields, island chains)
Landmass layout guide (geographic distribution only — render as realistic terrain, NOT as literal fantasy descriptions):
- Continent 1: roughly 50% of total land area
- Continent 2: roughly 50% of total land area
Distribute the 2 landmasses across the map with realistic continental shapes, coastlines, and terrain variety.

Equirectangular projection map texture, satellite view, highly detailed, realistic. CRITICAL: Do NOT render any text, labels, names, annotations, legends, or letters on the image. The output must be a pure photographic satellite-style map with zero text of any kind.

User Instructions:
A desolate, dusty orange planet with deep canyon scars, dry ocean basins, and rocky gray mountain ranges.

[ENVIRONMENTAL REQUIREMENTS]:
Ensure the map visually matches these parameters:
- Ocean Coverage: 45%
- Mean Temperature: 15°C
- Precipitation/Moisture Multiplier: 1x
- Continental Scale: 500
- Tectonic Intensity: 1.3
- Volcanic Density: 25%
[LANDMASS LAYOUT - visualize these as geographic regions, do NOT write their names on the map]:
- A landmass (~80% of total land area): A massive central supercontinent dominated by blasted badlands and volcanic ridges.
